wikipedia_page.main: Lawrie Madden (born 28 September 1955, in Hackney), is an English former professional footballer, who played in The Football League for nine different clubs between the 1970s and 1990s. He was a member of the Sheffield Wednesday side that won the 1991 League Cup.His final league side was Chesterfield, who he joined in October 1993 and left towards the end of the 1995–1996 season. His final League match was for Chesterfield at Oxford United, on 12 August 1995.

response: After the end of Johnny's professional football career he formed his own charity football team "Johnny Quinn's All Stars" featuring former professionals from around the South Yorkshire area such as Emlyn Hughes, Lawrie Madden, Imre Varadi and Mel Sterland. The All Stars have raised huge amounts of money for charity over the years and are still going today although Johnny Quinn announced he was pulling out as the figurehead of the All Stars in May 2006 with former Wednesday player Mel Sterland taking over. Sterland said at the time, "Johnny should get an MBE for what he's done for charities; the money raised must run into millions."
